title: Trust-Based Clinical Learning Design for Enhancing Medical Leadership Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Healthcare Systems and Management Experience
context.additional_context: Participants are managers or leaders with decision-making authority in clinical settings, requiring patient-caregiver trust-building and team-based collaboration competencies

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more communication strategies for building patient trust.
Learners can apply a framework for evaluating trust from the patient’s perspective in simulation environments to improve decision-making.
Learners can design and implement an integrated approach to attitudes, knowledge, and skills through problem-based learning scenarios.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
